Class Poised

java.lang.Object
Poised
public class Poised
extends java.lang.Object
The Poised class represents the actual project management software tool that the company employees will be using to keep track of ,add and edit projects in the POISEPMS SQL database and its respective tables.
Version:
4.0 April 7, 2021
Author:
Jonathan Okeke

  • Method Details

    • updateProjectList

      public static void updateProjectList​(java.util.ArrayList<Project> projectObjectList)
      Updates the list of lists variable "projectList". Updates old projects that have been edited by the user. Adds newly created projects as a new lists to the "projectList".
      Parameters:
      projectObjectList - An arraylist that holds all the instantiated project objects as list entries.

    • viewProjects

      public static void viewProjects()
      Displays the current projects and the project-related information.

    • viewPeople

      public static void viewPeople()
      Displays all persons directly involved with a specific project.

    • addNewProject

      public static void addNewProject​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.text.ParseException, java.sql.SQLException
      Allows user to create a new project. Will create a project object and update the project list as well as the SQL project's table. Will also create the relevant person object's related to the project.
      Parameters:
      statement -
      Throws:
      java.text.ParseException
      java.sql.SQLException

    • updateProjectDeadline

      public static void updateProjectDeadline​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Updates a specified project's deadline both in the project's SQL table and in the project list.
      Parameters:
      statement -
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • updateProjectFeePaid

      public static void updateProjectFeePaid​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Updates the amount the amount paid a customer to their related project. These changes will be reflected in the project's SQL table.
      Parameters:
      statement -
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • updateContractorContactInfo

      public static void updateContractorContactInfo​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Update the contact information for a specified Contractor. Changes will also reflect in the contractor's SQL table.
      Parameters:
      statement -
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • finaliseProject

      public static void finaliseProject​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Finalises a project specified by the user. This change will be reflected by updating the specific's projects Completion_Status to 'finalised' and update the project's Date_Completed field. Will generate an invoice if the customer has not paid the total project fee.
      Parameters:
      statement -
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
